title: Unique Houses
text: Homes of the from days past. These are beautiful homes built prior to the Civil War and into the late 19th Century. Beautiful to see. The cost a fortune to maintain. The local historical department in the city goverentment controls what and how work can be done on them. You need megs money to maintain one. Regularly patrked here when going to downtown Charleston.

title: Toiurst Market
text: Slaves are no longer sold here but tourist stuff is. This is the sight of the largest slave market in the US prior to the Civil War. A disgusting initial history but a source for that special item for a friend now. Have visited here many times when in downtown Charleston.

title: Good Visit
text: This is a good place to take the kids but it can be very expensive. It is not a larhge operation but has many exhibits. The main tank is 2 story and well populated, You cna buy year round ticked, expensive, but worth it if you are taking kids several times.

title: Good Starting Place
text: This is a great place to get oriented to start a visit to Charleston. Though I lived in the area, I often went here for information on activities, places to visit and the like, This visitor's center will make your visit very pleasent. Great staff.

title: Famous Light House
text: Once upon a time this light house stood on Morris Island but now it is out to sea. The island has washed away over time. A foundation is trying to keep it standing. It is mounted on a wood foundation driven into the sand. One time it helped guide ships into Charleston Harbor. Interesting bit of history.

title: Historically Interesting
text: Initial site of the first settlement / landing in the Charleston area during the colonial period. Lots of history. Worth seeing.
place: Charles Towne Landing State Historic Site

title: Sports Park
text: This is the home of Charleston's minor league base ball team, the River Dogs. It is well laid out. Some times the sun can be blinding depending on where you sit. Parking is a mess but not to expensive.

title: Started the Civil War
text: This is a State run Military Academy similar to West Point. Students from thos school fired the firdt shots in the American Civil War. Graduates of this school are very tight. It has been the subject of novels. It does not occupy its civil war grounds now but the building structhresmare very similar. Interesting for a quick visit.

title: Plantation of Old
text: I have spent a good bit of time here. It is expensive to visit but well worth it. A strong effort has been made to show the origional plantation and its gsrdens, Well worth a visit.

title: Interisting History
text: This is the last resting place for many of Charleston'sfamous individuals. There is a section devoted to deceased Confiderate Military people. It is on the Cooper River side of Charleston. You can feel the history here. I have madde several trips here.

title: Great Park
text: This is a very pleasing park to visit when in downtown Charleston. Play in the fountain, walk about or sit and watch the ships go by. Not a lot os shade. Carry a bottle of water for it can become warm. Have gone here many times.

title: Super Bridge
text: Super bridge. High enough to allow large freighters to pass below it. Fantastic replacement for the old bridges.. Great walking path on one side with a supert harbor view. It is also used by some as a race way though illegally,

title: Start of the Civil War
text: This is a most interesting place to visit. The first shots of the American Civil War were fired at this location. You can feel the history and the importance of this fortification while riding out to the fort along with walking about the property. Be sure to carry water with you for it can be very hot during the warmer months. Have visited several times. Well worth each trip.

title: Disappointing
text: Service was not very good. It approached terrible. The serviced brought the wrong order for us then wanted to argue about it. She also brought an incorrect check with items we did not order. Oh, should mention the food. Better just forget the good for it was on the pathetic side. No desire to return here.

title: Disappointed
text: We visited this restaurant over a year ago and we were disappointed. We understood ownership had changed hands so we decided to try again, I hate to say but the quality of what we had was not very good My wife had spaghetti and meat balls. The sauce was slightly flavored red water. There 3 large meat balls. Saying meat ball is inaccurate. They were bread crumb balls and tasted and looked it. Not very great. I had an Alfredo sauce. Unfortunately it was not very good I was totally disappointed I love a good Alfredo. This not a keeper but a dumper. The did not provide any bread - an Italian place?? In all honesty they were selling a lot of take out pizzas. Their pizzas may be good but I am not willing to try. Go back, no way. Disappointed.
